title: CLOSED: Access to Employment: Grass Roots Community Programme project call in New Anglia LEP area (OC24S16P0293)

change_history.note: CLOSED: project call in New Anglia LEP area (OC24S16P0293)

body.content:
This call is now closed. Please do not submit an application for this call. The information provided on this page is for reference purposes only.

Details

This call invites Outline Applications which support the delivery of Priority Axis 1, Investment Priority: 1.1 Access to employment for jobseekers and inactive people of the European Social Fund Operational Programme and responds to the local development need set out in the New Anglia Local Enterprise Partnership (LEP) area European Structural and Investment Funds Strategy.

Applicants are required to demonstrate local ownership and engagement in the project, it is envisaged that projects will define a specific geographical area, or areas, within which it will operate. Proposed activity will need to address locally identified needs in support of growth within the communities that the project will serve.
It is one of four complementary and simultaneous Calls under the European Social Fund seeking projects in the New Anglia LEP area which can meet some or all of the objectives of the Call through such bottom-up community led delivery mechanisms. There are other ESF calls linked to this call, the reference numbers are: 0C24S16P0294, OC24S16P0295, and OC24S16P0296

For more information, download the call specification.

Location

The project must be located within the New Anglia LEP area.

Value

Approximately £670,000 of funding is available.

Deadlines

Outline application deadline: 09-June-2016.

How to apply

To apply for funding under this call you will need to complete and send the Outline Application form to the email address provided in the call document. The guidance provides information to help you complete the form.

You are also advised to read the details in the call documents in order to produce an application that complies with the requirements and meets the needs set out in the Operational Programme. All this information, the related guidance and the European Social Fund Operational Programme can be found from our homepage.

What happens next

If your outline application is successful, we’ll contact you and ask you to make a full application.

Contact details

Contact. ESF.2014-2020@dwp.gsi.gov.uk

$CTA
This call is now closed.  Please do not submit an application for this call.  The information provided on this page is for reference purposes only.
$CTA

## Details
This call invites Outline Applications which support the delivery of Priority Axis 1, Investment Priority: 1.1 Access to employment for jobseekers and inactive people of the European Social Fund Operational Programme and responds to the local development need set out in the New Anglia Local Enterprise Partnership (LEP) area European Structural and Investment Funds Strategy.

Applicants are required to demonstrate local ownership and engagement in the project, it is envisaged that projects will define a specific geographical area, or areas, within which it will operate.  Proposed activity will need to address locally identified needs in support of growth within the communities that the project will serve.  
It is one of four complementary and simultaneous Calls under the European Social Fund seeking projects in the New Anglia LEP area which can meet some or all of the objectives of the Call through such bottom-up community led delivery mechanisms. There are other ESF calls linked to this call, the reference numbers are: 0C24S16P0294, OC24S16P0295, and OC24S16P0296
                                                                                                       
For more information, download the [InlineAttachment:New_Anglia_Call_Specification_OC24S16P0293.pdf] 

## Location

The project must be located within the New Anglia LEP area.

## Value

Approximately £670,000 of funding is available. 

## Deadlines

Outline application deadline: 09-June-2016.

## How to apply

To apply for funding under this call you will need to complete and send the [Outline Application]( https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/european-structural-and-investment-funds-outline-application) form to the email address provided in the call document. The [guidance]( https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/european-structural-and-investment-funds-outline-application) provides information to help you complete the form.  

You are also advised to read the details in the call documents in order to produce an application that complies with the requirements and meets the needs set out in the Operational Programme. All this information, the related guidance and the European Social Fund Operational Programme can be found from our [homepage](https://www.gov.uk/england-2014-to-2020-european-structural-and-investment-funds).

## What happens next

If your outline application is successful, we’ll contact you and ask you to make a full application.

## Contact details

Contact. [ESF.2014-2020@dwp.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:ESF.2014-2020@dwp.gsi.gov.uk)

description: Call to run a project providing help and support to the unemployed by responding to development needs in New Anglia LEP area.

finder.description: Find and apply to run projects backed by ESIF
finder.title: European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF)

details.summary:
Applies to: England (see guidance for Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland)

Apply to run projects backed by the European Structural and Investment Fund (ESIF). ESIF includes money from the European Social Fund (ESF), European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) and European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD).

allowed_values.label: European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development
